intro: Tetrapterocarpon septentrionale subsp. ihosiense, commonly known as the Iholi tree, is a member of the Rutaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces woody fruits that contain aromatic seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native habitat.
